author: nc1234
content: I think I have found the bug. It's related to Kurtosis.

author: nc1234
content:
So if I run this, lodestar is fine and Geth is not complaining about engine_newPayloadV5
```
  electra_fork_epoch: 0
  fulu_fork_epoch: 1
  eip7805_fork_epoch: 2
```
but if I run this, it will complain
```
  electra_fork_epoch: 0
  eip7805_fork_epoch: 2
```

author: nc1234
content:
I checked the EL config generated by Kurtosis, it looks like former case it will generate
```
"shanghaiTime":0,
"cancunTime":0,
"pragueTime":0,
"osakaTime":1742275837
```
but the latter, it will generate
```
"shanghaiTime":0,
"cancunTime":0,
"pragueTime":0,
"osakaTime":20942276601
```
the latter osaka time is 12 times larger than the former osaka time, so when the proper eip7805 fork is activated, EL still thinks it's in Pectra

author: nc1234
content: `20942276601` is like Aug 2633 (seconds from unix epoch)

author: jih2nn
content:
I think this is related to genesis generator. It seems it sets Osaka time only when `fulu_fork_epoch` is set: https://github.com/ethpandaops/ethereum-genesis-generator/blob/master/apps/el-gen/genesis_geth.py#L234-L239

In other words, I've checked this works correctly:
```
  electra_fork_epoch: 0
  fulu_fork_epoch: 1
  eip7805_fork_epoch: 1
```

However, not sure why Dora says all ILs are empty. Could you please check Lodestar regarding this one?
